definition: born at the wrong time (idiom); unlucky (esp. to complain about one's fate)/born under an unlucky star/ahead of his time
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
(negative prefix)/not/no
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period

sentences.english: He was an unrivalled talent, but unfortunately at the wrong time.
sentences.chinese: 他是个举世无双的奇才，可惜生不逢时。

sentences.english: Building an expensive, self-indulgent new headquarters building just in time for the collapse?
sentences.chinese: 一个奢华的，自我膨胀的新的总部大楼建得生不逢时？

sentences.english: They complained all the time about their bad luck and not being favored by chances.
sentences.chinese: 他们怨天尤人，大叹生不逢时，缺少机遇。

sentences.english: If so, perhaps they can blame the times that produced them.
sentences.chinese: 倘若如此，或许他们只能怪自己生不逢时。

sentences.english: Finally, complain god unfair, think oneself unlucky.
sentences.chinese: 到最后，抱怨老天不公平，认为自己生不逢时。

definition: to have talent but no opportunity (idiom)/to be an unrecognized talent
a hero with no chance of using his might/to have no opportunity to display one's talents
pinyin: ying1 xiong2 wu2 yong4 wu3 zhi1 di4

definition: fate is unfavorable (idiom); the omens are not good
heaven is jealous of heroic genius (idiom); the great have great hardship to contend with/those whom the Gods love die young
to meet with many difficulties in one's life (idiom)
bad times, adverse fate (idiom)
beautiful women suffer unhappy fates (idiom)
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
to die an untimely death (idiom)/to be cut off in one's prime
to sigh with regret/lament
Time makes the man (idiom). The trend of events brings forth the hero.
fate/destiny/CL:個|个[ge4]
to regret/to feel that it is a great pity/to feel sorry for sb
to bewail/to sigh mournfully/to lament
to bewail/to sigh mournfully/to lament
lamentable/sad(ly)

lit. raised up by Xiao He, cast down by Xiao He (idiom), alluding to Han Xin 韓信|韩信[Han2 Xin4] being made Grand General 大將軍|大将军[da4 jiang1 jun1]/fig. a situation where one's success and failure are both due to the same factor
pinyin: cheng2 ye3 Xiao1 He2 , bai4 ye3 Xiao1 He2
